name: NSUserDefaultsController
desc: A controller that accesses user preference information for your app from the user’s defaults database.

items.name: shared
items.desc: Returns the shared instance of NSUserDefaultsController, creating it if necessary.

items.name: defaults
items.desc: Returns the instance of NSUserDefaults in use by the receiver.

items.name: initialValues
items.desc: Returns a dictionary containing the receiver’s initial default values.

items.name: hasUnappliedChanges
items.desc: Returns whether the receiver has user default values that have not been saved to NSUserDefaults.

items.name: appliesImmediately
items.desc: Returns whether any changes made to bound user default properties are saved immediately.

items.name: values
items.desc: Returns a key value coding compliant object that is used to access the user default properties.

items.name: revert
items.desc: Causes the receiver to discard any unsaved changes to bound user default properties, restoring their previous values.

items.name: revertToInitialValues
items.desc: Causes the receiver to discard all edits and replace the values of all the user default properties with any corresponding values in the initialValues dictionary.

items.name: save
items.desc: Saves the values of the receiver’s user default properties.
